original: @76b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @76b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: au tsushma s'a dha nam /
analyzed: au tsushma s'a dha nam /
translated: UtsasƒÅdhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'chol ba'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: 'chol ba'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Sadhana of the Solitary Hero

original: 'phags pa dzambha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa dzambha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Jambhala.

original: mi bskyod pa'am tha mal snying gar ni //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'am tha mal snying gar ni //
translated: In the heart of Akshobhya or of oneself,

original: aa las zla snying h'um nag gser 'od can //
analyzed: aa las zla snying h'um nag gser 'od can //
translated: from A arises a moon and a heart, with a black Hum and golden light.

original: las byung rdo rje rtse dgu'i lte ba la //
analyzed: las byung rdo rje rtse dgu'i lte ba la //
translated: From the action [vajra] arises a nine-pointed vajra, in the center of which

original: zla steng h'um gi 'od kyis lha spyan drangs //
analyzed: zla steng h'um gi 'od kyis lha spyan drangs //
translated: is a moon, and the light of the Hum invites the deity.

original: mchod pas mnyes te rang gi snying gar zhugs //
analyzed: mchod pas mnyes te rang gi snying gar zhugs //
translated: Pleased by offerings, he enters into one's heart.

original: tshad med bzhi dang byang chub sems bskyed la //
analyzed: tshad med bzhi dang byang chub sems bskyed la //
translated: Having generated the four immeasurables and the mind of enlightenment,

original: rdo rje 'od kyis dngos kun lhar bsgyur thim //
analyzed: rdo rje 'od kyis dngos kun lhar bsgyur thim //
translated: the vajra light transforms all things into deities, which dissolve.

original: aom a'as spyan drang der bstim lhar gsal bya //
analyzed: aom a'as spyan drang der bstim lhar gsal bya //
translated: Om Ah invites him, and having dissolved, one should visualize the deity.

original: padma nyi mar nor bdag rgya na spras ba //üîΩnor skyug mgo rkang gnon pa khro ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: padma nyi mar nor bdag rgya na spras ba // nor skyug mgo rkang gnon pa khro ba'i gzugs //
translated: On a lotus and sun, the Lord of Wealth, adorned with ornaments,üîΩwith a face and feet trampling on the spilling wealth, with an angry form,

original: mi bskyod dbu mdzes thod khrag ne'u le 'dzin //
analyzed: mi bskyod dbu mdzes thod khrag ne'u le 'dzin //
translated: with the beautiful head of Akshobhya, holding a skull full of blood and a mongoose,

original: klus brgyan thugs kar zla ba sngar bzhin bsam //
analyzed: klus brgyan thugs kar zla ba sngar bzhin bsam //
translated: adorned with nagas, in the heart a moon as before.

original: @77a * // dbu zhal dpung pa g-yas g-yon thugs ka dang // g-yas g-yon brla dang gsang gnas byin gnyis la //
analyzed: @77a * // dbu zhal dpung pa g-yas g-yon thugs ka dang // g-yas g-yon brla dang gsang gnas byin gnyis la //
translated: the heart, the right and left thighs, and the two secret places.

original: zla bar yi ge bcu ba gser 'od 'phro //
analyzed: zla bar yi ge bcu ba gser 'od 'phro //
translated: On the moon are the ten syllables, radiating golden light.üîΩThe light makes offerings, transforms into gods, gathers wealth, and vomits it out.üîΩIn the palm of the hand, from va·πÉ comes a golden vase, which vomits jewels.

original: 'od kyis mchod dang lhar bsgyur nor bsdus skyug / lag mthil bam las gser bum rin chen skyug / mdzub mo gung mo ming med mthe'u chung dang // mthe bong nor 'chang g-yas g-yon yi ge bcu //
analyzed: 'od kyis mchod dang lhar bsgyur nor bsdus skyug / lag mthil bam las gser bum rin chen skyug / mdzub mo gung mo ming med mthe'u chung dang // mthe bong nor 'chang g-yas g-yon yi ge bcu //
translated: The index, middle, ring, and little fingers, and the thumb, are the ten syllables of the right and left hands.

original: aom aindra ni mu kham bhra ma ri sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aindra ni mu kham bhra ma ri sv'a h'a /
translated: O·πÉ indranimukha bhramarƒ´ svƒÅhƒÅ.

original: aom dza lum sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dza lum sv'a h'a /
translated: O·πÉ jalamu svƒÅhƒÅ.

original: rim bzhin byin gyis brlab dang dbul sngags so //
analyzed: rim bzhin byin gyis brlab dang dbul sngags so //
translated: The consecration and offering mantras are in order.üîΩThe water enters the hands, faces, and secret places,üîΩthen into the mouth as a stream of red and yellow.

original: phyag dang zhal dang gsang gnas nang nas phyag / de nas zhal du dmar ser chu rgyun 'jug / na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: phyag dang zhal dang gsang gnas nang nas phyag / de nas zhal du dmar ser chu rgyun 'jug / na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: Namo ratnatrayƒÅya.

original: na mo ma ni bha dr'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ma ni bha dr'a ya /
translated: Namo manibhadrƒÅya.

original: ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
analyzed: ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
translated: MahƒÅyak·π£asenƒÅpataye.

original: aom dzambha la dza lendra ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dzambha la dza lendra ye sv'a h'a /
translated: O·πÉ jambhala jalen-draya svƒÅhƒÅ.

original: lo phyed thun drug chu phul 'byor chen 'grub //
analyzed: lo phyed thun drug chu phul 'byor chen 'grub //
translated: For half a year, offering water in six sessions, one attains great wealth.

original: spogs na h'um mdzad khros pas dug khrag dang // tsha ba ske tshe mar khus byugs te bskam //
analyzed: spogs na h'um mdzad khros pas dug khrag dang // tsha ba ske tshe mar khus byugs te bskam //
translated: and a mixture of hot substances, mustard seed, and oil, one should dry [the effigy].

original: ram las khong par gru gsum me bsams dbul //
analyzed: ram las khong par gru gsum me bsams dbul //
translated: From ram, one should imagine a triangle in the stomach, and fire.

original: sa'am rdo las mkhyid gang sku gzugs bya //
analyzed: sa'am rdo las mkhyid gang sku gzugs bya //
translated: One should make an image of the size of a cubit from clay or stone.

original: lha bstim thab khung gzhug ste mchod par bya //
analyzed: lha bstim thab khung gzhug ste mchod par bya //
translated: Having absorbed the deity, one should place it in the hearth and make offerings.

original: rtsibs brgyad 'khor lor sku 'am sngags bris te //
analyzed: rtsibs brgyad 'khor lor sku 'am sngags bris te //
translated: One should write the body or the mantra on an eight-spoked wheel,

original: lha bstims dril te rin chen 'bar gzugs 'chang //
analyzed: lha bstims dril te rin chen 'bar gzugs 'chang //
translated: and having absorbed the wisdom being, one should place it in a precious blazing form.

original: sna tshogs rgyun du zhabs nas chu 'dzag pa'i //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyun du zhabs nas chu 'dzag pa'i //
translated: In a vessel with a spout, a continuous stream of water drips from the foot.

original: 'og tu lha sku ye shes bstims pa gzhug /
analyzed: 'og tu lha sku ye shes bstims pa gzhug /
translated: Below, one should place the body of the deity with the wisdom being absorbed.üîΩOn the pillow or on the wall, one should draw the body and absorb the wisdom being.

original: mal logs sngas sam sku bri ye shes gzhug / gzugs brnyan snod nang 'chang byas chud bul lo //
analyzed: mal logs sngas sam sku bri ye shes gzhug / gzugs brnyan snod nang 'chang byas chud bul lo //
translated: The image is placed in a vessel and covered with ashes.

original: au tsushma sgrub pa'i thabs thun mong ma yin pa slob dpon sgeg pa rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: au tsushma sgrub pa'i thabs thun mong ma yin pa slob dpon sgeg pa rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The uncommon method of accomplishing Ucchusma, composed by Master Lalitavajra, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta chen po d'a na sh'i las bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta chen po d'a na sh'i las bsgyur ba'o /
translated: Translated by the great Indian pandit Danashila from the east.
